title: Proclamation on Regulatory Relief for Certain Stationary Sources to Promote American Coke Oven Processing Security
summary: The proclamation describes steel as a vital material for the U.S. economy and daily life, noting its roles in construction, transportation, energy systems, and military hardware. It outlines regulatory relief for certain stationary sources as a means to promote the security and resilience of American coke oven processing capacity.

title: Nominations Sent to the Senate for Executive-Branch Positions (November 2025)
summary: The White House announced nominations to the United States Senate for multiple executive-branch appointments. The announced nominees include Robert Cekada for Director of the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives; Carter Crow for General Counsel of the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission for a four-year term; Stuart Levenbach for Director of the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection for a five-year term; and David Clay Fowlkes among others. The list indicates the administration's intent to fill leadership roles across federal agencies.

title: Proclamation on National Adoption Month, 2025
summary: The President proclaims November 2025 as National Adoption Month, recognizing the importance of stable, nurturing homes for children and the role of adoption in providing family stability. The proclamation emphasizes awareness, support for prospective and current adoptive families, and encourages government agencies, organizations, and the public to participate in activities and initiatives that promote the well-being of children and families through adoption.

title: Executive Order on Fostering Family Stability and Foster Care
summary: This executive order, issued by the President under the authority of the Constitution and federal law, sets forth the administrationâ€™s policies to support family stability and the foster care system. It states the goal of enabling parents to raise children in safe and loving homes and outlines government responsibilities and actions to address crises and other events that interfere with that arrangement, including the management, improvement, and coordination of foster care provisions and related supports for children and families.

title: Proclamation: Anti-Communism Week, 2025
summary: The President designates Anti-Communism Week as a period for solemn remembrance of the historical devastation associated with communist regimes and the impact on people around the world. The proclamation notes that more than 100 million lives have been lost under such regimes and calls for reflection on the consequences of totalitarian ideologies, while reaffirming a commitment to individual rights, freedom, and democratic values. Observances are encouraged to educate and remind the public of these historical events and their lessons for current and future generations.
